info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 9:40PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
info.description:
RIVER RISES ON THE TAKU RIVER, SEEN ON THE USGS GAUGE ALONG WITH PUBLIC REPORTS, INDICATE THAT THE ANNUAL GLACIER LAKE OUTBURST FLOODING EVENT FROM LAKE NO LAKE HAS STARTED AND IS CURRENTLY ONGOING. THE RIVER WILL CONTINUE TO RISE STEADILY THROUGH THE NEXT 24 HOURS WITH A FORECAST CREST OF 41.9FT AROUND 10AM JULY 1ST. THIS CREST IS JUST BELOW BANKFULL CONDITIONS OF 42 FEET AND BELOW MINOR FLOOD STAGE OF 43 FEET. NO SIGNIFICANT IMPACTS ARE EXPECTED AT THIS TIME.
PEOPLE WHO LIVE OR RECREATE ON THE TAKU RIVER OR AROUND TAKU INLET SHOULD REMAIN AWARE OF THE RISING RIVER CONDITIONS AND POTENTIAL HAZARDOUS DEBRIS IN THE WATER. CHECK BACK FOR UPDATES ON THIS EVENT.
FOR TAKU RIVER NEAR JUNEAU: AT 9:30PM THE STAGE WAS 39.9 FEET AND RISING. FLOOD STAGE IS 43.0 FEET. FORECAST: A CREST AROUND 41.9 FEET IS EXPECTED AROUND 10:00AM TUESDAY.
IMPACTS: AT 43.3 FEET: THE WATER LEVEL WILL BE AT THE TOP OF THE HILL IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE NEAR THE GAUGE.

parameter.value: GLACIER LAKE OUTBURST FLOODING EVENT ON TAKU RIVER ONGOING
